stack writes:
[...]
> The rest of the page describes how heritrix behaves when it comes across 
> multibyte pages (Missing is description of a new feature recently added 
> to HEAD that allows specification of crawler headers such as 
> 'Accept-Language' which might be of use to you for sites that serve 
> content based off the browser language setting).

Neither 'Accept-Language' nor 'Accept-Charset' effect the issues
described on <http://crawler.archive.org/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?CharsetsAndCrawling>;
you run into the same multibyte regexp issues regardless of the declared
Accept-Language and Accept-Charset in the request.

I have not experienced any character set corruption issues with
Japanese sites in my use of the crawler.

    -tree
